comments.content:
‚ö†Ô∏è Other Options Explained:
B. Implement case variation by altering the case of SQL statements
‚Ä¢ Most modern IDSs normalize input.
üö´ Limited effectiveness.

C. Leverage string concatenation to break identifiable keywords
‚Ä¢ Turns UNION SELECT into UNI + ON SEL + ECT
‚Ä¢ Some IDS systems detect common string obfuscation patterns, so this is partially effective, but not stealthy.
‚ö†Ô∏è Moderately useful for application-level filters, but weaker at the network layer.

D. Use Hex encoding to represent the SQL query string
‚Ä¢ Converts payload to something like 0x73656c65637420 (select )
‚Ä¢ Many modern IDS/IPS systems decode hex automatically
‚ö†Ô∏è Good for bypassing input filters, less effective at evading advanced IDS.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer: A

According to EC-Council training materials (especially CEH ‚Äî Certified Ethical Hacker), the most effective evasion technique against signature-based Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) is: 
üîê Employing IP Fragmentation
"IP fragmentation is one of the most effective techniques to evade signature-based IDS, as it breaks the attack payload into multiple packets that may not be reassembled correctly by the IDS."

choices.D: Use Hex encoding to represent the SQL query string
choices.C: Leverage string concatenation to break identifiable keywords
choices.A: Employ IP fragmentation to obscure the attack payload
choices.B: Implement case variation by altering the case of SQL statements

questions.question_text: An ethical hacker is testing the security of a website's database system against SQL Injection attacks. They discover that the IDS has a strong signature detection mechanism to detect typical SQL injection patterns. Which evasion technique can be most effectively used to bypass the IDS signature detection while performing a SQL Injection attack?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C ‚Äì updating and patching regularly

Incorrect answers:
A) limiting number of connections ‚Äì if server is unpatched and vulnerable, even 1 well crafted connection can break it.
B) WAF ‚Äì good solution to have but it can‚Äôt avoid all kinds of exploits against unpatched server.
D) SSL/TLS encryption ‚Äì protects data in transport but not server itself.

questions.question_text: You have been hired as an intern at a start-up company. Your first task is to help set up a basic web server for the company's new website. The team leader has asked you to make sure the server is secure from common threats. Based on your knowledge from studying for the CEH exam, which of the following actions should be your priority to secure the web server?

choices.C: Regularly updating and patching the server software
choices.D: Encrypting the company's website with SSL/TLS
choices.A: Limiting the number of concurrent connections to the server

questions.question_text:
Bobby, an attacker, targeted a user and decided to hijack and intercept all their wireless communications. He installed a fake communication tower between two authentic endpoints to mislead the victim. Bobby used this virtual tower to interrupt the data transmission between the user and real tower, attempting to hijack an active session. Upon receiving the user‚Äôs request, Bobby manipulated the traffic with the virtual tower and redirected the victim to a malicious website.
What is the attack performed by Bobby in the above scenario?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The aLTEr attack is a Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) attack on LTE networks that allows attackers to redirect user traffic to malicious websites by exploiting vulnerabilities in the LTE (4G) protocol encryption.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

A. aLTEr attack

However, I think there might be a slight mistake in the answer. Based on the scenario, I believe the correct answer is actually:

IMSI Catcher attack (also known as a "Stingray" attack)

But since that's not an option, I'll explain why I think aLTEr attack is not the correct answer:

aLTEr attack is a type of attack that targets LTE networks, but it's not typically associated with hijacking wireless communications or redirecting users to malicious websites.

On the other hand, an IMSI Catcher attack (or Stingray attack) involves using a fake cell tower to intercept and manipulate wireless communications. This is exactly what Bobby did in the scenario

Selected Answer: A
aLTEr attack is an attack that uses dns spoofing to perform MITM attacks, attacker sets up a fake cell tower, pretends to be the victim of the real network and tries to intercept traffic

Selected Answer: D
is only correct answer

Selected Answer: D
A and B are incorrect syntax and C only refers to local machine so D is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Being a Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), a company has brought you on board to evaluate the safety measures in place for their network system. The company uses a network time protocol server in the demilitarized zone. During your enumeration, you decide to run a ntptrace command. Given the syntax: ntptrace [-n] [-m maxhosts] [servername/IP_address], which command usage would best serve your objective to find where the NTP server obtains the time from and to trace the list of NTP servers connected to the network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The difference between tracert(windows) and traceroute(linux) is that:
 - tracert(windows) will only use ICMP echo requests.
 - traceroute(linux) [and somewhat dependent on linux distro] default to UDP echo requests.

https://serverfault.com/questions/385529/different-between-tracertwindows-and-traceroutelinux

questions.question_text: A Certified Ethical Hacker is attempting to gather information about a target organization's network structure through network footprinting. During the operation, they encounter ICMP blocking by the target system's firewall. The hacker wants to ascertain the path that packets take to the host system from a source, using an alternative protocol. Which of the following actions should the hacker consider next?

choices.B: Use the ICMP Traceroute on the Windows operating system as it is the default utility.
choices.D: Utilize the Path Analyzer Pro to trace the route from the source to the destination target systems.
choices.A: Use UDP Traceroute in the Linux operating system by executing the 'traceroute' command with the destination IP or domain name.
choices.C: Use the ARIN Whois database search tool to find the network range of the target network.
